Container.Name: Dnsmasq
Container.Description: [b]What is Dnsmasq?[/b][br/] Dnsmasq provides network infrastructure for small networks: DNS, DHCP, router advertisement and network boot. It is designed to be lightweight and have a small footprint, suitable for resource constrained routers and firewalls. It has also been widely used for tethering on smartphones and portable hotspots, and to support virtual networking in virtualisation frameworks.[br/] [br/] [b]Container Volumes:[/b][br/] * /etc/dnsmasq.d : configuration files storage volume[br/] * /tftpboot : tftp files storage volume[br/] [br/] [b]Network Ports:[/b][br/] * 53 : Default port for DNS[br/] * 67 : Default port for BOOTPS[br/] * 69 : Default port for TFTP[br/]
